unnormalised: Real estate in Mumbai's Bandra saw a huge jump this quarter! Property prices are up by almost 15% compared to last year. Apparently, a new sea-facing apartment sold for a whopping Rs. 50 cr! Can you believe it?
normalised: Real estate in Mumbai's Bandra saw a huge jump this quarter! Property prices are up by almost fifteen percent compared to last year. Apparently, a new sea-facing apartment sold for a whopping rupee fifty crore! Can you believe it?

unnormalised: Word on the street is that NRIs are investing heavily in the area. A lot of fancy new condos are being built near Linking Road. One building, "Sunshine Towers," has flats starting from Rs. 5 crore onwards. Crazy, right?
normalised: Word on the street is that N-R-Is are investing heavily in the area. A lot of fancy new condos are being built near Linking Road. One building, "Sunshine Towers," has flats starting from rupee five crore onwards. Crazy, right?

unnormalised: Experts are saying that the increase in demand is due to the area's prime location and good connectivity. Plus, everyone wants that "Mumbai dream" of owning a house near the sea. The average size of a 2BHK flat is around 800 sq ft and goes for around Rs 3 cr these days.
normalised: Experts are saying that the increase in demand is due to the area's prime location and good connectivity. Plus, everyone wants that "Mumbai dream" of owning a house near the sea. The average size of a two B-H-K flat is around eight hundred square feet and goes for around rupee three crore these days.

unnormalised: But, is it sustainable? Some folks are worried about a bubble. Guess we'll have to wait and watch! But for now, if you're looking to invest in Mumbai real estate, Bandra is where the action is at.
normalised: But, is it sustainable? Some folks are worried about a bubble. Guess we'll have to wait and watch! But for now, if you're looking to invest in Mumbai real estate, Bandra is where the action is at.
